title: What amount of spending to close 10B gap

content.question: An economy is currently producing <math alttext="$250" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>250</mn></math> billion of output. The full-employment output is <math alttext="$260" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>260</mn></math> billion, and the marginal propensity to consume is <math alttext="0.75" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.75</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Assuming no crowding out and a horizontal aggregate supply curve, what level of additional spending is necessary to achieve full employment?

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Interpret a specific economic outcome using quantitative data or calculations.
